message: When all the threads are done, we signal to the consumers of the outputqueue it will not be getting any more items. After the remaining items are consumed, consumer threads are allowed to gracefully exit. That way, they don't hang indefinitely waiting for more items that will never come, avoiding potential deadlocks.
author: Anonymous

message: Top-level statements, a feature in C# 9 and newer, allows us to directly write code without having to define a public static void Main function, removing boilerplate code.
author: Afshin-A

message: Provides a framework to manage the lifecycle of our application, dependency injection, logging, and configuration.

message: Sealed classes cannot be inherited from. It is to prevent changing their implementation

message: This is a strongly-typed POCO object that gets automatically populated from the Configuration set from various means, including env variables, json configuration files, and commandline options.
